DOC.detailed_description: Major depressive disorder ( MDD ) serious psychiatric disorder affect approximately 1 every 12 15 child adolescent . Depression cause problem school , family , friend , leave untreated , difficulty persist adulthood . Treatments use antidepressant form psychotherapy show effective reducing symptom depression . However , many youth experience return depressive symptom within 1 2 year remission . Recent study show add cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) , form psychotherapy focus behavioral modification , initial antidepressant treatment may increase remission reduce relapse rate . This study compare effectiveness fluoxetine alone versus fluoxetine plus add CBT increase recovery prevent relapse youth MDD . Participation study last 78 week . Potential participant undergo initial screening , include interview questionnaire mood , behavior , medical history ; vital sign measurement ; meet psychiatrist ; lab draw and/or urine drug pregnancy test indicate psychiatrist . All eligible participant begin 6 week treatment fluoxetine . During 6-week period , participant attend weekly study visit , include vital sign measurement , questionnaire symptom mood , medication dosage adjustment . At Week 6 , participant evaluate independent evaluator determine whether depression significantly improve . Participants improve fluoxetine end study participation provide recommendation treatment option . All participant show significant improvement continue receive fluoxetine another 24 week , total 30 week treatment . Half participant randomly assign additionally receive CBT remain 24 week . All participant attend study visit occur every week 3 month monthly 3 month . These visit last 20 30 minute include vital sign measurement question mood behavior . Participants receive CBT also attend 10 12 CBT session , last 50 minute occur weekly first 4 week , every week 1.5 month , monthly last 3 month . The CBT session involve individual child parent-child session , focus modify depressive thought , feeling , behavior . Participants undergo repeat evaluation independent evaluator Weeks 12 , 18 , 24 , 30 , 52 , 78 .
